cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.category: Tropical Storm (potential – not yet at SSHS hurricane strength)
cyclone.current_location: about 475 mi south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north toward the north-central Gulf Coast, then forecast to arc northeast across the southeastern United States toward the Carolinas late weekend–early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast of Louisiana (Intracoastal City–MS/AL border)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None affecting the Mid-Atlantic; current watch area is along the north-central Gulf Coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Intracoastal City, LA, eastward to the AL/FL border including Lakes Pontchartrain & Maurepas and metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: coast from Louisiana through Mississippi, Alabama, and the western Florida Panhandle, then inland through the Southeast U.S.
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: No station in the wind-probability table is close to Wilmington, DE (nearest listed point is ATLANTA GA, >500 mi away)
weather_observation.wind: None – gale-force winds not expected to reach Wilmington, DE within 5-day window
weather_observation.storm_surge: None – surge confined to Gulf Coast
weather_observation.rainfall: None – any remnant rainfall reaching the Mid-Atlantic should be light
